common_errors.cause: Target host is not listening on specified port, or service is down
common_errors.solution: Verify service is running on target: ss -tlnp | grep <port>. Check firewall rules.

common_errors.cause: Target unreachable, firewall blocking, or network routing issues
common_errors.solution: Check network connectivity: ping host. Check firewall: iptables -L. Verify routing: traceroute host

common_errors.cause: Network can't find path to destination host
common_errors.solution: Check routing table: ip route. Verify default gateway. Check if host exists on network.

common_errors.cause: DNS resolution failed - hostname can't be resolved to IP
common_errors.solution: Check DNS: nslookup hostname. Use IP address directly. Check /etc/resolv.conf.

common_errors.cause: Server terminated connection (authentication fail, protocol error, idle timeout)
common_errors.solution: Check server logs. Verify correct protocol. May need authentication.

common_errors.cause: telnet not installed (often omitted from minimal installs)
common_errors.solution: Install: apt install telnet / yum install telnet. Or use nc (netcat) as alternative.

common_errors.error_pattern: Unable to connect to remote host
common_errors.cause: Generic connection failure - could be network, firewall, or service issue
common_errors.solution: Diagnose with: ping (network), traceroute (routing), nc -zv host port (port check)

common_errors.cause: Not an error - telnet is connected and waiting for input
common_errors.solution: This is normal. Type commands. Use Ctrl+] then 'quit' to exit.

common_errors.cause: No network route exists to the destination network
common_errors.solution: Check network interface is up: ip link. Check default route exists: ip route.

common_errors.cause: Trying to bind to privileged port (<1024) without root, or socket restricted
common_errors.solution: Use sudo for privileged ports. Check SELinux/AppArmor if socket access restricted.
